case_studies.title: Multi-Tenant Merchant Platform
case_studies.subtitle: Building the infrastructure that powers 500+ sellers
case_studies.tagline: 99.99% uptime SFTP gateway serving 500+ merchants simultaneously

problem.title: The Challenge
problem.description: Teams were losing money to FTP ingress bottlenecks. The previous system experienced frequent unplanned downtime, which directly impacted merchant revenue and support burden.
pain_points: FTP service went down 2-3 times per week, each incident lasting 30+ minutes
No horizontal scalability - single server architecture unable to handle concurrent connections
Manual recovery process took 15-20 minutes per incident
Zero observability into connection states or failure modes
Merchants had no way to verify upload status in real-time
problem.business_impact: $15k+ monthly revenue at risk during outages

solution.title: The Architecture
solution.description: Architected a multi-tenant SFTP gateway using AWS managed services and infrastructure-as-code, achieving 99.99% uptime and linear scalability.

approach.name: Multi-tenant AWS Transfer Family Gateway
approach.details: Deployed AWS Transfer Family with Terraform IaC, replacing single-server FTP with managed, highly available SFTP infrastructure

approach.name: Automated S3 Integration
approach.details: Direct S3 backend integration with lifecycle policies, automatic archival, and cross-region replication for disaster recovery

approach.name: Real-time Monitoring & Alerting
approach.details: Prometheus + Grafana for connection metrics, CloudWatch alarms for anomaly detection, PagerDuty for incident escalation

approach.name: Zero-downtime Deployment
approach.details: Blue-green deployment strategy using Terraform workspaces, tested migrations, instant rollback capability

approach.name: Multi-region Active-Active Setup
approach.details: Distributed across 2 AWS regions with Route53 health checks and automatic failover (<5 second RTO)

results.title: Impact & Metrics

metrics.label: MTTR Reduction
metrics.description: Automatic failover eliminated manual recovery time

metrics.label: Merchants Supported
metrics.description: Horizontal scaling from 50 concurrent connections to 5000+

qualitative_impact: Eliminated merchant support tickets related to upload failures (was #3 support category)
Reduced on-call burden to near-zero for this component
Enabled real-time merchant dashboards showing upload status
Improved team velocity - no more firefighting deployments

lessons_learned.title: Managed Services > DIY Infrastructure
lessons_learned.insight: AWS Transfer Family was more cost-effective and reliable than maintaining custom SFTP servers, despite perceived overhead

lessons_learned.title: Observability First
lessons_learned.insight: Investment in Prometheus/Grafana dashboards caught issues before they became incidents. Spend on monitoring pays dividends

lessons_learned.title: Automation Enables Reliability
lessons_learned.insight: Blue-green deployments and automated failover transformed reliability from a manual concern to an architectural property

lessons_learned.title: Multi-region Active-Active is Worth It
lessons_learned.insight: For critical infrastructure, ~15% infrastructure cost increase is trivial compared to revenue impact of even one unplanned outage

technologies_deep_dive.name: AWS Transfer Family
technologies_deep_dive.why: Eliminates vulnerability to single-server failure modes. Managed service handles protocol compliance, security patching, capacity planning

technologies_deep_dive.name: Terraform
technologies_deep_dive.why: IaC enabled reproducible infrastructure, version control, and team review process for all changes. Reduces human error

technologies_deep_dive.name: Prometheus + Grafana
technologies_deep_dive.why: Real-time metrics visibility enabled proactive scaling and incident prevention rather than reactive firefighting

case_studies.title: Real-Time Data Pipeline
case_studies.subtitle: Reducing query latency from minutes to milliseconds
case_studies.tagline: ELT pipeline serving real-time analytics to 100+ concurrent users

problem.title: The Challenge
problem.description: Analytics queries took 5-10 minutes to return, making real-time decision-making impossible. The team was forced to rely on stale daily snapshots.
pain_points: Queries running for 5-10 minutes blocking critical business decisions
nightly ETL batch process unable to keep up with data volume growth
Data warehouse (Redshift) costs spiraling due to inefficient queries
No ability to drill into metrics in real-time during incidents
Analytics team unable to explore data interactively
problem.business_impact: Lost competitive advantage from inability to act on real-time insights

solution.title: The Architecture
solution.description: Redesigned as an ELT pipeline using Dagster orchestration, DLT for streaming transformations, and ClickHouse for analytics queries.

approach.name: Dagster Orchestration
approach.details: Event-driven pipeline replacing time-based batch jobs. Automated dependency resolution, data lineage tracking, and failure recovery

approach.name: DLT (Data Load Tool)
approach.details: Streaming ingestion from source systems with automatic schema detection and evolution. Handles schema changes without manual intervention

approach.name: ClickHouse Column Store
approach.details: Replaced Redshift for analytics queries. 50x faster query performance on typical analytical workloads

approach.name: Apache Kafka Topics
approach.details: Real-time event stream for high-frequency metrics (user actions, transactions, etc.). 'Source of truth' for event data

approach.name: Python Data Transformations
approach.details: Polars-based transformations for speed, type safety via Pydantic for data quality validation

results.title: Impact & Metrics

metrics.label: Data Freshness
metrics.description: From daily snapshots to real-time streaming

metrics.label: Pipeline Reliability
metrics.description: Automated retry logic and error recovery

qualitative_impact: Enabled real-time dashboards for executive team (Grafana, Metabase)
Analytics team now spends time on insights, not waiting for queries
Product team can A/B test with real-time statistical significance calculations
Incident response improved: can drill into root cause in seconds vs. hours

lessons_learned.title: Choose the Right Tool for the Job
lessons_learned.insight: ELT > ETL for fast-moving data. DLT handles schema evolution automatically. ClickHouse designed for analytical queries.

lessons_learned.title: Event Streaming Changes Everything
lessons_learned.insight: Kafka enables real-time decision-making. Batch processes are legacy thinking for modern analytics

lessons_learned.title: Data Quality Validation is Non-Negotiable
lessons_learned.insight: Pydantic schemas caught data anomalies before they reached dashboards. Saved countless hours debugging bad reports

lessons_learned.title: Infrastructure Costs Matter
lessons_learned.insight: Choosing the right data warehouse (ClickHouse vs Redshift) yielded 60% cost reduction AND better performance

technologies_deep_dive.name: Dagster
technologies_deep_dive.why: Superior to Airflow for data pipelines. Event-driven model enables real-time responsiveness. Data lineage out-of-the-box

technologies_deep_dive.name: ClickHouse
technologies_deep_dive.why: Designed for OLAP workloads. 10-100x faster than traditional data warehouses on analytical queries. Open source, cost-effective

technologies_deep_dive.name: DLT
technologies_deep_dive.why: Eliminates glue code. Handles schema evolution, data type inference, incremental loading. Built-in data quality checks
